text.section:
Beginning with the effective date of a lobbying registration and extending through the ending date of the registration period, a lobbyist who lobbies a local official, or a person acting on behalf of the lobbyist, may not:
solicit or transmit directly or indirectly a contribution from any person, including a political committee, for the benefit of a local official or candidate;
serve on a fund-raising committee of, or a political committee for the benefit of, a local official or candidate; or
act as a treasurer or chairman of a political committee for the benefit of a local official or candidate.

This Part VI may not be construed to prohibit a lobbyist from:
making a personal contribution within the limitations established under the Election Law Article; or
informing the lobbyist's employer or others of the positions taken by a particular candidate for office.

section.section: Any person who knowingly and willfully violates the provisions of this Part VI is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction is subject to a fine of not more than $1,000 or imprisonment for not more than 1 year or both.

If the person is a business entity and not a natural person, each officer and partner of the business entity who knowingly authorized or participated in the violation is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction is subject to the same penalties as the business entity.
